snippet.textDisplay:
An Open Message To Everyone Sad About Mecha Anime:


There is a lot of good mecha anime, and you cannot experience true emptiness until you've watched it all. Start with Getter Robo OVAs - in the specific order of New Getter Robo, then Shin Getter Robo vs. Neo Getter Robo, then the true Getter Robo OVA, Getter Robo: Armageddon.


If you haven't yet, get into Gundam. You can skip ZZ and Victory if you want, they have psychological problems and some weird intentional inclusions of naked kids. Actually, all of UC Gundam has that problem. Watch G Gundam, it's standalone, Wing Gundam, it's standalone, and then either make the long chronological trek from Mobile Suit Gundam up to Turn A Gundam to fully appreciate the intended end of the UC era, or just watch After War Gundam X for the same kind of story in 39 episodes.

Now it's time to get into Mazinkaiser, the Go Nagai Super Robot Anime. You will now look up Fire Wars, and find the Mazinkaiser SKL Fire Wars AMV. You now want to watch Mazinkaizer, so get on that. You watch Mazinger; hey, that's a lot of fun.


From this point on, you'll wanna hit up RahXephon and Eureka Seven, or as professors call them, "Evangelion For Adults. And eco-hippies and Mayans, don't litter." If you haven't watched Evangelion yet, watch it between RahXephon and Eureka Seven to appreciate all three series to their maximum. Do not watch Eureka Seven AO. Do Not Watch Eureka Seven AO.


You watch Gunbuster. You are a man now. You watch Diebuster; you are a powerful man now.


Alright, you've been interspersing your ups and downs, so now it's time to watch Gurren Lagann as a mecha fan, with most of the series it's referencing now totally recognizable. You've already seen it before, but now it's special. You cry. You're happy and yet so sad. You get the ending now, and it's actually pretty good. You watch Gurren-hen and Lagann-hen, the compilation movies, for the canon endings to those arcs. There is something stronger than a human within you now, and you don't know what to say.


Your world is changing. Giant robots make you happy; you miss them in the real world. 4chan seems worth visiting if only to find new material. Now you move onto things that you never would have watched before; Combattler V, and Giant Robo. You discover they're actually pretty fun. You watch Appleseed; fuck it, it has robots.


You watch Infinite Ryvius; fuck it, it has a robot. Wow, that was sad.


You watch Martian Successor Nadesico. Hey, that was pretty good. That's a really good opening song; you'll listen to it every now and then from now on.


You watch Metal Armor Dragonar, and it's not that bad. And then the cold settles in.


Because you realize how little good mecha anime there is left.


You watch Five-Star Stories; wow, that's some nice animation.


You watch Legend Of The Galactic Heroes; you pretend it's the sequel to Zeta Gundam, no one blames you. It has no mecha.


You watch Macross, and you believe mankind is tragically worth saving. You feel safe; there's much more Macross than you expected.


And slowly, you hear fewer and fewer recommendations. You start reading the Gundam manga; there's a lot of it. It could be worse.


You watch Attack on Titan and cannot stop referring to the shifters as Pilots. You play Titanfall 2's campaign three times.


And you realize that the world is going quiet; you don't have many options left. You watch UFO Robot Grandizer and Steel Jeeg; it's different, but it helps. You feel bitterly proud of having come this far.


You watch Blue Comet SPT Layzner; a hidden classic. Nice. You now come to the shocking revelation that you will never find a show you like again without using the Super Robot games as reference material, to find whatever there is left.


You watch Tekkaman Blade and pretend that he's a robot. You're hiding now. No one blames you.




In a journey that defined you, made you a stronger and better person, you hit the bottom of the mecha burnout experience. You didn't watch everything, you know that; it's not all worth watching right now. You'll get around to it.


You're part of, unanimously, the most bitter and heavily 80's-90's defined of all fandoms. You feel like a prophet when you speak to newbies of the things to come.


And as you read this, a chill sets into you. You wouldn't take it back.


But God, you wish you could remember what it was like when you started.


There will always be Gundam, and it is by this slim, silver cord you hold on.


You're one of us now. And you will never, ever be able to have a fruitful media conversation with normies ever again.

snippet.textDisplay: I really loved Aldnoa Zero, and Gargantia. Personally my most favorite anime of all time.
snippet.textOriginal: I really loved Aldnoa Zero, and Gargantia. Personally my most favorite anime of all time.

snippet.textDisplay: It's just the natural life cycle of genres, like Westerns, Mecha's time has passed.
snippet.textOriginal: It's just the natural life cycle of genres, like Westerns, Mecha's time has passed.

snippet.textDisplay: Yeah I really agree with the thing you said about the Gundam series. It's too intimidating now. I wasn't into anime when it was getting going and I don't really know or care to know where to start it now. One of my favorite games of all time was Armored Core 2. I'd love to see good mecha anime. I enjoyed Darling in the Franxx before it went of the rails (and still a bit after) but there is no way I'm watching a Gundam series.  I'd love a new series that really sells me on mecha anime.
snippet.textOriginal: Yeah I really agree with the thing you said about the Gundam series. It's too intimidating now. I wasn't into anime when it was getting going and I don't really know or care to know where to start it now. One of my favorite games of all time was Armored Core 2. I'd love to see good mecha anime. I enjoyed Darling in the Franxx before it went of the rails (and still a bit after) but there is no way I'm watching a Gundam series.  I'd love a new series that really sells me on mecha anime.

snippet.textDisplay: My two favorite genres of anime are Mecha ( Code Geass, Rexephon etc) and Space Opera ( Cowboy Bebop, Outlaw Star and Infinite Riyvius). I think what will happen to resurrect these genres is the same thing that resurrected Shonen and Seinen: they need a MHA or a One Punch Man to give them a shot in the arm.
snippet.textOriginal: My two favorite genres of anime are Mecha ( Code Geass, Rexephon etc) and Space Opera ( Cowboy Bebop, Outlaw Star and Infinite Riyvius). I think what will happen to resurrect these genres is the same thing that resurrected Shonen and Seinen: they need a MHA or a One Punch Man to give them a shot in the arm.
